projectArray.title: Pokedex Project
projectArray.content: during this Project, the class was encouraged to create a pokemon trainer showcase (Pokedex) website that displayed information using AJAX to retrieve said data. We focused on client side technologies and learned about Object Oriented programming, JavaScript, APIs, AJAX, grid systems, SASS, UI/UX and deployment via Github Pages. DEPLOYED ON GITHUB

projectArray.title: Pokemon Gym
projectArray.content: The main goal was to work together via GitHub  implementing Agile software. It was imperative to understand each member's code before implementing your own. This skill is essential to successfully work within a software engineering team.

projectArray.title: Bakery Website
projectArray.content: The main goal was to work on Ubuntu using Ruby and Sinatra along with other gems. During this project, we built a class object per item sold. These objects represent digital versions of cookies/cakes/muffins which were stored as data that we utilized when displaying information about our items. Also learned to make a CSV file. DEPLOYED ON HEROKU

projectArray.title: Full Stack Food blog
projectArray.content: This was far my favorite Project. EggsOnTheWall is a FullStack food inspired web application. I created using Ruby and Sinatra. In this website, you'll be able to create/delete an account as well as to create posts. Upon successful completion of this project, I was able to obtain an understanding of Sinatra, ActiveRecord, Cookies, log-in and log-out functions and deployment to Heroku.

projectArray.title: FullStack School Admin Page
projectArray.content: this website was made with Ruby on rails. The purpose of this web application was to keep track of academic records of students, teachers, as well as courses and cohorts. Designed with Semantic UI
